CatDescriptText: Mrs. Jacob Silberman, businesswoman, 5533 Wellesley and "Ed" Radzyminski, trucker, Pittsburgh, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, December 12, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is as much opportunity for the self-made man to succeed today as there was in the past, or is this the era of the 'trained' or 'educated' man?  Or do you think it is 'who you know' not 'what you know'?" Mrs. Jacob Siberman's answer reads: "Ambition is the word which guarantees success.  There are marvelous opportunities today for everybody."  Mr. "Ed" Radzyminski's answer reads: "The self-made man still has a good chance today as he did before."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mrs. Jacob Silberman wearing dark fur coat, dark gloves, and patterned hat, standing in front of window with sign inscribed "Join Our Christian Club NOW!"; Portrait of "Ed" Radzyminski wearing dark zippered jacket, plaid button down collared shirt, and light colored hat, standing on Liberty Avenue with Mellon Bank sign in background, Downtown
